author: WSJ Staff
title: WSJ Wealth Adviser Briefing: Taxes, Scholarships, Depression
text: Are you still preparing your adult children’s taxes? Many parents are, writes Katherine Bindley. Bridget Cusick is 42 and the director of marketing with the Archdiocese of New York. She has never done her taxes. Her 74-year-old dad, a retired attorney from Barron, Wis., does them for her. “It’s very turnkey for me,” Ms. Cusick   ​Chinese Companies Head Back to the Bond Market Next Total Makes a Power Move—Energy Journal
